hero.title: International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine
hero.subtitle: Uniting entrepreneurs for business development, international cooperation, and strengthening Ukraine's economy. Together we shape the future of Ukrainian entrepreneurship.

aboutPreview.title: About the Association
aboutPreview.text: The International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine (MAPU) is a powerful platform for uniting entrepreneurs who strive to develop their business, establish international connections, and promote the economic growth of Ukraine.
aboutPreview.text2: Founded in 2020, MAPU has already united over 500 entrepreneurs from various economic sectors — from IT and agriculture to manufacturing and services.

about.pageSubtitle: Learn about our history, mission, and values
about.historyText1: The International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine (MAPU) was founded in 2020 by a group of leading Ukrainian entrepreneurs who recognized the need to create a powerful platform for uniting the business community.
about.historyText2: The beginning of activities coincided with unprecedented challenges for the economy. It was during this time that MAPU demonstrated its value — uniting entrepreneurs for mutual support and knowledge exchange.
about.historyText3: Over the years, the association has united over 500 entrepreneurs from 24 regions, organized more than 100 events, and established partnerships with 50+ organizations worldwide.
about.year1Text: Association created by a group of 50 founding entrepreneurs.
about.year2Text: Growth to 200 members. Launch of mentorship program.
about.year3Text: Entrepreneur support fund and business relocation program.
about.year4Text: Offices in Poland and Germany. Export program launch.
about.year5Text: Launch of digital platform for business networking.
about.missionText: To promote entrepreneurship in Ukraine by uniting the business community, protecting entrepreneurs' interests, developing international cooperation, and implementing the world's best business practices.
about.visionText: We envision Ukraine as a country with a powerful and innovative entrepreneurial ecosystem where every entrepreneur has access to resources and opportunities.

values.integrityDesc: We act transparently and responsibly in all our endeavors.
values.innovationDesc: We support the implementation of new technologies and approaches in business.
values.cooperationDesc: We believe in the power of unity and mutual support.
values.developmentDesc: We promote continuous professional growth of our members.

about.dir1Desc: Organization of business meetings, forums, and conferences
about.dir3Desc: Representing business interests at the government level

statutePage.title: Statute
statutePage.subtitle: The founding document of the International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine. Approved by the General Assembly of Founders.
statutePage.section1Text:
1.1. The International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine (hereinafter — the Association, MAPU) is a voluntary, non-profit, independent association of individuals and legal entities — business entities, independent of state authorities and local self-government bodies.

1.2. The Association operates in accordance with the Constitution of Ukraine, the Law of Ukraine "On Public Associations", the Civil and Commercial Codes of Ukraine, other legal regulations, and this Statute.

1.3. Full name: International Association of Entrepreneurs of Ukraine. Abbreviated name: MAPU.

1.4. The Association is a legal entity from the moment of state registration, has an independent balance sheet, bank accounts, seal, stamps, letterheads with its name and symbols.

1.5. The Association has the right to acquire property and personal non-property rights in its own name, bear obligations, and be a plaintiff and defendant in court.

1.6. Legal address of the Association: 22 Khreshchatyk St., office 301, Kyiv, Ukraine.
statutePage.section2Title: Chapter II. Purpose, Objectives, and Areas of Activity
statutePage.section3Title: Chapter III. Membership in the Association
statutePage.section4Title: Chapter IV. Rights of Association Members
statutePage.section5Title: Chapter V. Obligations of Association Members
statutePage.section6Title: Chapter VI. General Assembly of Members
statutePage.section7Title: Chapter VII. Council of the Association
statutePage.section8Title: Chapter VIII. President of the Association
statutePage.section10Title: Chapter X. Committees and Working Groups
statutePage.section12Title: Chapter XII. Property and Financial Activities
statutePage.section14Title: Chapter XIV. Procedure for Amending the Statute
statutePage.section14Text:
14.1. Amendments and additions to this Statute are adopted by the General Assembly by a qualified majority — at least 2/3 of votes of the total number of members present.

14.2. Proposals for amending the Statute may be submitted by:
— the Council of the Association;
— the President;
— a group of Association members numbering at least 1/5 of the total membership.

14.3. The draft amendments to the Statute shall be sent to all Association members no later than 30 days before the General Assembly.

14.4. Amendments to the Statute are subject to state registration in accordance with established legal procedures and take effect from the moment of registration.
statutePage.section15Title: Chapter XV. Termination of the Association's Activities
statutePage.section15Text:
15.1. The Association's activities are terminated through reorganization (merger, accession, division, transformation) or liquidation.

15.2. The decision to reorganize or liquidate is adopted by the General Assembly by a qualified majority — at least 2/3 of votes of the total number of Association members.

15.3. Liquidation is carried out by a liquidation commission appointed by the General Assembly.

15.4. In case of liquidation, the Association's property and funds, after satisfying creditors' claims, are directed toward achieving statutory goals or charitable purposes as decided by the General Assembly. Distribution of remaining property among Association members is prohibited.

15.5. The Association's activities may also be terminated by court order in cases provided by Ukrainian legislation.

15.6. The Association is considered to have ceased its activities from the moment the corresponding entry is made in the Unified State Register.

contactsPage.title: Contacts
contactsPage.subtitle: Have questions? We're always happy to help
contactsPage.name: Your Name
contactsPage.subject: Subject
contactsPage.faq1Q: How do I become a MAPU member?
contactsPage.faq1A: Fill out the application on the Membership page, describe your entrepreneurial achievements, and complete an interview with the Council.
contactsPage.faq2A: No, MAPU membership is completely free. Admission is based solely on the candidate's entrepreneurial achievements.
contactsPage.faq3Q: Can I participate in events online?
contactsPage.faq3A: Yes, most events are held in a hybrid format.

membershipPage.title: MAPU Membership
membershipPage.subtitle: Merit-based membership — join the community of 500+ successful entrepreneurs
membershipPage.step1: Fill out the application and describe your achievements
membershipPage.step2: Complete an interview with Council members
membershipPage.motivation: Why do you want to become a MAPU member?
membershipPage.criteriaSubtitle: MAPU membership recognizes your entrepreneurial achievements. Membership is free.
membershipPage.criteria1Desc: At least 2 years of successful business operations in Ukraine or abroad
membershipPage.criteria2Desc: Impeccable business reputation and adherence to ethical business standards
membershipPage.criteria3Desc: Recommendation from two current MAPU members or partner organizations
membershipPage.criteria4Desc: Willingness to share experience, mentor, and participate in association projects
